intro: Geranium humile var. kauaiense, commonly known as Kauai geranium, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It is a herbaceous perennial with small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often near streams or in rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. This species is part of the Geraniaceae family and is notable for its limited distribution and ecological significance in Hawaiian ecosystems.
